meanings.definition: To give too much water to (a plant)
meanings.sent1: I accidentally overwatered my tomato plant and now it looks sad.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to overwater your houseplants, as it can lead to root rot.
meanings.sent3: My friend joked that I must have overwatered my cactus because it started growing fins.
meanings.sent4: The garden was overwatered with rain, causing the flowers to droop heavily.
meanings.sent5: The farmer overwatered the fields, drowning the crops in too much moisture.

meanings.definition: Having been given too much water
meanings.sent1: The overwatered soil in the garden was soggy and muddy.
meanings.sent2: The overwatered plant wilted under the weight of too much moisture.
meanings.sent3: The overwatered lawn squelched underfoot as we walked across it.
meanings.sent4: The overwatered flowerpot overflowed with excess water, spilling onto the table.
meanings.sent5: The overwatered tree branches sagged heavily, burdened by the excess water.
